storyInfo: With the guidance of Andoain, Federico and Arturia head underground to search for the Law. Mostima and Fiammetta decide to work separately from Lemuen in their attempts to stop the procession of pilgrims. Meanwhile, Mon3tr and the Doctor get a lock on Priestess's trail.

attributes.content: Loosen up that trigger finger, Fiammetta.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I get the impression that scowl's stuck on your face until you get to fire off a few grenades.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Thinking about that disgusting dream just makes me even angrier.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Too bad it wasn't entirely a dream.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Look over there, waaaaay in the distance.
attributes.name: Mostima
Fiammetta
attributes.content: The Shrine of Nurtury's still there...

attributes.name: Fiammetta
attributes.content: Let's go, Mostima, to the hospital.
Doesn't matter if what just happened was a dream or not, we need to make sure thatâ€”
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: The fact that I'm the first person you thought of really means something to me, Fiammetta.

attributes.name: Fiammetta
attributes.content: Lemuen?

attributes.name: Fiammetta
attributes.content: I'm so glad you're alright.
How're your legs?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: A little sore.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I was running all over that dream until I was dead tired. Getting to sit down is a treat... Alright, alright, the two of you can relax now.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: What the hell's going on here?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: (Shakes head) It was only my second day after being created cardinal, and I was headed to the office like usual. It might have been the moment I stepped out the front door, or maybe when I saw the Shrine...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I can't really say when I left reality. It all happened so naturally.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: What is it, Fiammetta?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Salvete, everyone.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Capâ€”
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Y-You're still keepingâ€”
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: What are you up to, wearing that?!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: A friend kept it for me. You have a very kind junior, Fiammetta.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: She told me this wasn't something to just throw away. Perhaps today, I will finally reach my destination. To be clothed in these vestments as I do so may be fate at work.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Why you...
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Andoain has an important role to play. Resolving your existing disputes is not a priorityâ€”
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's been a while, Federico.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I know who you are and how you like to get things done, and I know that according to the Curia's rules, saints have the highest authority in emergency situations... But please give us a little time.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Please keep it brief.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The last time the four of us got together like this was that fateful mission, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: It's been ten years.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: We reached the underground palace, Fiammetta got a distress signal from another team and went to go help them, while Andoain was revising our tactics at the entrance.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: We laughed as we shared the last of the chestnut scones... An old habit of our team. I remember the day well.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: We were so happy back then... I thought those days would never end. Nobody could've imagined what would come next.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: You caused all this, Andoain, but you still refuse to tell the truth, or at least repent.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Our brief time together may have been one of life's accidents.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But it was a... precious one.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I ruined it... in a way I did not foresee.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I understand how deeply you treasure that time, Fiammetta. Your love burned so hot, it singed the hearts of those around you. I...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I always wanted to thank you for one thing. You were the one who taught me how to love Laterano.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But at the same time, I knew I would hurt you, and destroy what you so cherish.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I am a villain. It would be just for you to hate me.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Are you trying to piss me off, Andoain?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Whether or not I hate you is for me to decide, not you.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: I understand that, and I am grateful for it. I am fortunate to have made a friend like you.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Go do what you need to do.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: But remember, I won't forgive you. I never will.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: These two are taking you to the Basilica, right, Andoain?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: It is I who is taking them, Lemuen.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Which means you're still determined to walk this path?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Of course I am.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Will it be dangerous?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Unknown might be the better word.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Have you ever thought of stopping?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Whether I am the captain who attacked you, or an arrogant, naive nurturer in a dream... My doubts, my fixations, my mistakes... They have all led me here.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I cannot stop.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Alright then.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: It's hard to call Laterano 'Paradise' the way it is now.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: That monster running rampant across the city, those strange things she reared wandering all over the place. Nobody really knows what's going on, or what will come next...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: The three of us need to work out a way to solve these issues and find El, who's gone missing. As for you, your wounds look rather serious...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You might die, Andoain. We might die.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: We've talked about Rocamarea, about its belltower and its rainy nights, about the mute child you buried in Sargon, about the miner's frozen legs you had to amputate in Ursus...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You told me about all sorts of places, and I remember them all.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I always pitied you. I understood many of your opinions, and I never disagreed with you, but I could never truly understand you. I was much the same for you.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: We are both clear on that matter, just as you know how grateful I am for your pity.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Well, I am a Lateran, aren't I?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: That is where you shine the brightest. I will always remember how you taught me to shoot a gun.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Speaking of, where is that gun now?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I left it in Laterano.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Ten years ago, it was your final mission with our team of commandos. Even if nothing had happened, you would still have left.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Which means these words came a little late, is all.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Right...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It's been far too long since that day... And I'm glad of it. Gratitude and blame no longer hang so heavy.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Well then...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Farewell, Andoain.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Lemuen speaks no further. Mostima goes up to her wheelchair, looking Andoain square in the eyes.
I know what you're about to say, no need to thank me. Farewell, 'Captain'.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Fiammetta looks at Andoain, then at her two friends. She stays silent.
Farewell.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Cardinal Lemuen, there are some tasks I must assign to the three of you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You doing alright, Fiammetta?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: ...I'm fine.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Fiammetta, I...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: This thing... might involve me, but I know it's not only my problem, or Andoain's. These past two years have taught me that.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Yeah, I should really learn that too.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Alright, enough about that. Right now... If what Federico says is true, the most important thing is to act quickly.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Good thing there's no arms control in real life. I can blast those monsters as soon as I see them.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: I'll cover you, just like the old days.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Wait a sec, Lemuen.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Federico just said that Sanktas who attack them will Fall.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Falling's no walk in the park, trust me on that.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: About half of the people awake in the city are Sanktas. Without their numbers, we won't be able to stop such a large procession.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Unless...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: We add in those fallen Angels and errari Federico mentioned.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Wait, he said they were pretty emotionally charged and didn't know what they were up to, not to mention that he's only got temporary command over them.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Not like they need steady nerves or pure intentions to help out. Relax, I'll handle them.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I'm a Fallen Angel too, and I've spent lots of time outside of Laterano.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: We got any better choices for angel wrangler?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: It still won't be enough. The situation on the road from the Shrine of Nurtury to the Basilica is too complex. We need to get administrative permissions for the roadside facilities along the way ASAP.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I'll head back to the Seventh Tribunal for a bit.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: By yourself?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Don't trust my wheelchair skills?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You'll make me mad.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Quick, let her rub your ear tufts a bit.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Since the two of you have everything planned out, what else is there for me to add?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Let's split up... 'teammates'.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: We have to go now, children.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Hugo, help take care of our new Sankta friends, alright?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Yes, Sister.
attributes.name: BolÃ­varian Child

attributes.content: Where did Senior Nurturer go?
attributes.name: Panicking Child

attributes.content: Did he stop caring about us?
attributes.name: Fearful Child

attributes.content: He just has to go handle a few things for a little while.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Think about it. We don't know each other very well, so if he didn't promise me he'd come back, why would I agree to take care of you?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Ohhh, you're right.
attributes.name: Panicking Child

attributes.content: Right, would you like to hear the story of how the lost Zhayedan captured the Castle of Dreams?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Or maybe how the Kheshig brought gold to marry the princess of Gaul, but the gold turned to sand storm, burying Lingones?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Huh? That's not what we learned in history class...
attributes.name: Fearful Child

attributes.content: They're not stories you'd hear in Laterano! I can tell them to you while we walk.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Here, some bread from Patia. You haven't eaten since we got into the city.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Making up tall tales for children again, Nueda?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: I'm curious, do other K'uk'ulkan treasure the knowledge in your heads as much as you do?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: I've never met another of my kind.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: If I can turn that knowledge into stories for children with a little tweaking, then it means there's still some use for it. Otherwise, it will just be a scattering of pale fragments in my mind.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Hmph. You have a surprisingly flexible mindset.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Oh, right, are you disappointed?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: About what?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: You traveled all this way to Laterano, to your holy land, but it wasn't apples and fireworks that welcomed you, or a loving God of universal salvation...
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Instead, you've got rampaging demons.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: I am disappointed... but not completely.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Have I ever told you how I became a nun, Aurela?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Please do.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: As you know, I wandered all around BolÃ­var from a young age.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: It wasn't hard to survive, my knowledge proved useful on that front. As for my parents, even if I forgot what they looked like, they still managed to fill my head with lots of things.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: But I couldn't understand the more complicated parts. They pointed to the Black Flow, the far edge of the sea, the depths of the dunes of gold, even the space beyond the stars. They spoke of race after race, secret after secret...
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Not a good fit for a place like BolÃ­var.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Which is why I hate them, Aurela. Everywhere I look, I see soldiers fighting over men and money, artillery firing left and right, and BolÃ­varians caught in the crossfire...
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: And all I had were pale fragments.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Until I was thirteen, when I met a nun.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: A band of True BolÃ­varians guerrillas had robbed her. She was gravely injured, leaning against a rock and close to death.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: But when I got close, I could hear her singing.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Her bandages had fused with her festering wounds. She must have been in so much pain in the final moments of her life, yet she was still so serene...
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: It was a hymn, one that had always been in my mind, one that I had pored over in puzzlement countless times.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.text: Abode of our Lord, font of parental loveâ™ª
He punishes evil and drives out injusticeâ™ª
All shall bask in His loveâ™ª
Whether they have scars or stonesâ™ª

attributes.content: Until that very moment, when some of those pale fragments took on color and form, and came together into something calledâ€”
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Laterano.
attributes.name: Nueda & Aurela

attributes.content: So you took up her habit.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: I did.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Even if Paradise is pure and spotless white, to me, it cannot compare to the very first time I heard that hymn.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Nueda, forget everyone else, take the kids and follow that Patia girl. She looks like she knows her way around town.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Alright. Wait, you're staying at the Tower of Revelations?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: But the executor said...
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: A long-since-Fallen Sankta doesn't need to listen to a saint.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: The night we fled BolÃ­var, I told you why I wanted to come back.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: R-Revenge.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: I saw that old bastard through my scope just now. He's at the head of the pack.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: I won't let him go.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: We all have our own obsessions when it comes to Laterano, Nueda.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: It's strange, seeing the Basilica devoid of people.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Follow me, please, Arturia.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Here it is.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: The pillars of scripture?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Between these two pillars is a slab engraved with The Saints' Travels. Press the halos of the saint statues in the same order as listed on the slab, then push this wall.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I have reported to His Holiness here many times before, but I never noticed this hidden mechanism.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Maybe because you've never doubted Laterano.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I hope what you are about to see will not sway your faith.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I'm looking forward to it already.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Andoain followed the Pope down here once.
They had passed the buried bones of saints, passed steles and statues showcasing their deeds, walked through thousands of years of Laterano before arriving at the end of history.
But...
Andoain suspects his memories are still in disarray.
The former white of the corridor is gone, entirely replaced with the dour, cold sheen of iron.
Statues of saints still line the path, but bizarrely-shaped lumps of machinery protrude from the walls, engulfing their arms, eyes and legs.
It seems like devils have had their way with our history.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I thank you for your warning, Andoain. I would have been much more surprised otherwise.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: No, this place has changed.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Andoain furrows his brow. Off in the distance, he sees a red light, blinking faintly. He knows what it is.
Do you see that red light?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: That's where we're going, but we should only be seeing it much further down this corridor...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Stay alert.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: A cloaked guard suddenly appears. The moment he sees Federico, he starts firing. There is no room for negotiation.
Alert.
attributes.name: Shrine Patrol

attributes.content: Repeat, alert. Intruders sighted, eliminating on site.
attributes.name: Shrine Patrol

attributes.content: An ear-piercing siren begins to wail, as more and more guards file into the trio's field of view. Their blurry visages hide beneath their cloaks, like spirits in shadow...
While their halos shine all the more dazzling.
The guards protecting the Shrine of Nurtury in the dream are now here.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: This means... We're in the right place.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Stand behind me.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: This isn't the dream.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: It's obviously still reality, so why'd all the color...?
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: It's quiet here. We won't be disturbed by all the commotion over there.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: She stands at the corner, looking out across the deathly silence, completely unguarded against you.
But I don't like it, {@nickname}. It's perhaps too quiet.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But we have no other choice, do we?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (She's not limiting me, Doctor.)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: (Amiya's not here. I can't guarantee I can hold her off... but I'll do my bestâ€”)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Relax, you're safe.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I won't allow you to be disturbed by the chaos these Sanktas caused.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: Why are you here?;I thought you were still locked up in Rhodes Island.

attributes.content: That doesn't matter, compared to what's currently on my mind.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Entering attack mode.)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: (Sorry, Doctor, she might have shown up because of me...)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: (I never thought she'd catch onto me when I tried to access PCSâ€”)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Calamity? I see only the evolution of a species, the pointless struggle of life.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Everything happening in Laterano right now is a product of PCS's autonomous derivations.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: All I did was recalibrate it beforehand, returning it to its original purpose. Of course, it has adapted to the progress of the Originium project since.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Speaking of progress, ours has slowed far behind projections, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Good to know you haven't lost your curiosity.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: PCS was an experiment developed using bionics, one that once offered many benefits to our soldiers and scientists.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But it was left behind on Terra, and without long-term maintenance, its cognitive radiation amplifier entered partial standby mode, and its operational efficiency is now extremely reduced.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But what's interesting is what happened after it came into contact with Terra's native species. It didn't have the effect I expectedâ€”
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Not only were its beneficiaries able to share their knowledge and emotion, but even their species-specific traits were assimilated. That never happened during our testing.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: A rather pleasant surprise, isn't it, {@nickname}?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Good to know you haven't lost your curiosity.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: PCS was an experiment developed using bionics, though we were never able to understand its true nature. There was also the risk of it disrupting the subjects' cognitive functions when usedâ€”
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But in the face of grim disaster, it was still brought into service ahead of schedule.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It can reduce barriers to communication and strengthen the bonds between individuals, all while maintaining thinking abilities and personality...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: This offered many benefits to our soldiers and scientists.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It has been gathering dust since it was left behind on Terra, but as you know, {@nickname}, it is still far from operating to its full potential.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: You mentioned it adapting to the Originium project's progress?;What connection does it have to the Originium project?

attributes.content: Don't get excited, {@nickname}, I'll explain everything.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: However, your new companion seems like she has something to say to you.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Bad news, Doctor, I can't find a way out of here.)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: If her goal is still Originium...
We might not be in Laterano anymore...;This might be the future of Laterano...

attributes.content: As keen an intuition as ever, but one that lacks basic knowledge.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: This is just a vision of a possible future I conjured up for you using the PCS system.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: No more time, no more color. A place locked in eternal stasis.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It's rare for us to have a chance to walk together, {@nickname}. Come, leave behind these conflicts that have nothing to do with you.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: No. You're afraid I'll access the PCS system.;You didn't expect me to show up here either.

attributes.content: I sense... hate in your voice. I understand.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It's because of AMa-10, your 'Kal'tsit'.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You left in such a hurry last time. You still have many doubts you have not yet cleared, while I have many conjectures I must confirm with you.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Something's... strange about the way she's acting. Her expression's different from when she was back on the deck.)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: (I could try an attackâ€”)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Put away those talons.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I respect that you've given yourself a name, 'Mon3tr', but I understand your fundamental underpinnings better than you do.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: If you want AMa-10 back, I can help you, {@nickname}. You know where to find me.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I know that's what you want too, Mon3tr.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: Don't get taken in by her, Mon3tr!

attributes.content: You've always clung to the connection between matter and reality.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Originium is the language we created, so naturally, I can use it to make my words heard by whoever I want.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It is so for you, and it is so for that machineâ€”
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: 'In response to me, it propagated, then created an even larger cache to perform a new round of calculations.'
'The machine operates on its installed logic, seeking the continuation of itself and its community that has achieved emotional resonance.'
'But in your haste, you decided this was an error to be stopped. Even those Sanktas regard it as rejection from the Law...'
'Follow me, {@nickname}.'
'Witness a true crisis with your own eyes.'
Every department of the Curia has its own offices. The Basilica is merely ceremonial. There should not be such a complex space beneath it.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We must perform one final round of testing.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You said you went down a one-way passage before, right, Andoain?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But we've changed direction six times, and now we're here again.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Seven, actually.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...We head back.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The three of them return to their former position. A platform, one where the white of a church blends with the black of machinery, wantonly streaked with red light emanating from an unknown source...

Disorder, chaos, imbalance, danger... No matter if from an architectural or religious point of view, shape and structure here has lost all meaning. They cannot stop themselves from wondering if they are still in Laterano.
Federico and Arturia stop walking at the same time. This is an exceedingly familiar experience. Before they met the Witch King, they wandered an infinite flight of stairs.
There is no need to go any further.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: This is a derived structure that did not originally exist. While I do not know the principles or processes behind it, it has without a doubt warped space here.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We are in an incomprehensible maze.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: He is preventing us from approaching.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Who?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The God of the Sankta, the answer to everything.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Don't expose our position, Fede.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I don't sense any human emotions coming from them. Are they really Sanktas, or are they machines here to tidy up the maze?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They are most likely the same as the organisms above ground. If ordinary Sanktas attack them, they will Fall.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The deeper we go, the more of them there are, and the stronger their... 'empathy' becomes.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We beat back a wave of them, and that just draws in another... We'll end up completely overwhelmed.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The procession is moving at a fast pace, and will not need much time to arrive at the Basilica. It is highly unlikely Cardinal Lemuen's team will be able to stop their advance completely.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We must learn the entire truth about this calamity. We have wasted too much time already.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Perhaps I may be of some use.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: You are severely wounded.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I'll leave the patrols to the two of you.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But when it comes to pathfinding, I happen to be rather good at that.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Light gathers in Andoain's palm.
Arts?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: *cough* Thank you, Andoain.
attributes.name: Injured Townsfolk

attributes.content: You shouldn't go so far, SeÃ±or Jaime! I didn't see you all day! I only found out you came to the beach after asking around.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I just wanted to find something to eat... Didn't think the sea fog would be this thick.
attributes.name: Injured Townsfolk

attributes.content: Even if there wasn't any fog, pirates roam these parts!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: You shouldn't leave Rocamarea just because you feel like it... At least... At least ask me to come with you next time.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Alright, alright... Speaking of, was that your Arts just now?
attributes.name: Injured Townsfolk

attributes.content: The fog was so dense, I couldn't even see my own shoes. I thought I'd be lost forever, but then a ray of light came by...
attributes.name: Injured Townsfolk

attributes.content: I-I thought someone managed to repair the local lighthouse or something!
attributes.name: Injured Townsfolk

attributes.content: No need to be so dramatic! I'm just glad I managed to help you.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But Andoain, I heard your people use guns, custom-made ones.
attributes.name: Injured Townsfolk

attributes.content: I also heard your homeland, that place called Laterano, is a universal Paradise...
attributes.name: Injured Townsfolk

attributes.content: My home is Rocamarea. I was born here and raised here, SeÃ±or Jaime.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Let's go home. I'll carry the food.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: The light parts the dawn mist, and our quarry's line of sight is blocked. I will show the way. Now's your chance, Fiammetta.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Got them!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Lemuen, Mostima, sweep the battlefield.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Understood, Captain.
attributes.name: Lemuen & Mostima

attributes.content: Not bad, Andoain, keeping a trick up your sleeve like that! There's way too many bandits in this gang. Without your Arts, we wouldn't have been able to resolve things this quickly.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: It's just an unconscious reaction. It got me and others out of trouble a few times, before I got my guardian gun.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Without it, I wouldn't have been able to find Laterano.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I nearly forgot you only got your gun the day before you joined the Pontifica Cohors... But you're pretty good with it! Can't tell you've never used it before!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: It's a part of a Lateran's life, isn't it? I should be practiced with it.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Besides, as I've found out recently, guns and halos are what keep Laterano invincible. It doesn't need this glimmer of mine.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Talking about that stuff again, Andoain?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Haha, sorry.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: This operation's gone pretty off-the-rails compared to the original plan from the Pontifica Cohors. Should we write up the details as-is? Ah, whatever, I'm sure you'll polish up the final report.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: But what about the places outside Laterano?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: How many Rocamareas, how many lonely islands are there beyond the reach of the faith?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I cannot forget. I can see...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Andoain?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Is it Laterano, or...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: No, no, there is no difference.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: If, through the spiritual light, even the darkest stain can be cleansed; if, with a pious heart, even a savage monster can wade out of the mud...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Does that not mean there are no lonely islands beyond the reach of the faith?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Then why is it that all I've seen, everyone I've known, couldn't be saved? There must be something missing, something I overlooked...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: A path.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Not a power, nor a place, but simply... a path, a path that leads from present torments to future salvation.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I-If you can show me the future, then you must know the path that leads to it. Tell me, show it to me...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: The colossus of nothingness swims through gaps in space-time. It does not respond to Andoain.
The details of that strange yet oh-so-real sight begin to warp and flow with Its silence, and everything is smeared with a thick layer of clouds.
No, no...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I need to know more!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Can you hear what I'm saying, Andoain?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Put that thing down...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: No, Lemuen. You don't know what I saw. I can't stop here!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Light bursts forth from Andoain's hand, like a plant rushing headlong into season, blooming as if about to wither.
He wants to part the clouds. He wants to see the revelation in all clarity. He wants to grasp onto the possibility.
From then on, once more did he set foot on a journey, bearing sin and evil upon his back. He guided foreign believers to Laterano, searching for an answer.
But he had no time to share what he saw, the truth that nearly shook him to his core.
He had walked so many paths, yet what was the one thing that remained constant?
He will always remember that year, the year the salt wind buried his home, and the emotions he bore in his heart as he left Rocamareaâ€”
That was the starting point of his journey.

The sounds of the executor fighting the patrols do not stop. Andoain does not hold back as he casts his Arts, an endless font of light flowing from his body, winding its way into the depths of the maze.
Rather than a harsh light, it is gentle, perhaps even dim, like sunlight caressing a patch of autumn leaves, tracing the paths through which they fall.
He asks himself: 'Pathfinder, where does this path end?'
Until finally...
A glaring red light cuts off his Arts.
Once, he saw this alongside Yvangelista XI. Once, he found himself shaken...
The light is more icy, more piercing, more dangerous than before.
But Andoain does not close his eyes.
He knows that cold machine is his Lord, his god, the foundation of his faith.
Andoain faces God. He does not turn away.
He has sought and he has lost. He has pondered and he has doubted.
A sharp pain runs through him. It only takes a moment for his vision to go dark, but at the same time...
He hears God's answer.
